result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon J. Jacobson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Intent to Certify Debt to the WI Dept. of Revenue.
of Intent to Refer Debt to the WI Dept. of Revenue mailed to Defendant, along w/JFFO.

[MA]Case called at 10:34am
Defendant Johnathon J. Jacobson in court with attorney Teri Strohschein.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

In response to the Court's Letter, Mr. Jacobson indicates that he would only like to proceed with sentencing after revocation on this case, will not be self revoking on other cases (15CM434 & 15CM490)

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 7 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for all purposes; to commence FORTHWITH
--115 days credit for time already served given

--Mr. Jacobson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

Outstanding costs and fees are to be reduced to civil judgment. 
recess: 10:44am
Letter from Court re the 3/9/18 Sentencing After Revocation

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 9, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CM434, 15CM488 & 15CM490 called together at 2:35 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Johnathon J. Jacobson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CM434, Count #1-15CM488, Count #1-15CM490; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-15CM434 & Count #2-15CM490

On Count #1-15CM434, Count #1-15CM488, Count #1-15CM490, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To maintain employment and/or education program and make honest and legitimate efforts to maintain employment
--No contact with any known drug offenders, except as authorized by DOC for treatment purposes
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession or use of drug paraphernalia
--No acts/threats of violence
--To submit DNA Sample
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge per count
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges

Days credit for time already served: 0 days-15CM434
Days credit for time already served: 0 days-15CM488
Days credit for time already served: 0 days-15CM490
Court presents basis and grants expungement, on each case, under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation
Defendant to report to probation by end of business 6/14/16
Recess: 3:10 pm

Prior: 408 Jefferson St., Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States

Cases 15CM488, 15CM434 & 15CM490 called at 2:04 pm [sf]
Defendant Johnathon J. Jacobson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews procedural posture of the case.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond to cover all 3 cases, with previous non-monetary conditions

Recess: 2:07 pm

NEXT: (1) Status Conference scheduled for 6/13/16 at 2:30 pm  - send notices
Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD

Cases 15CM434, 15CM488 and 15CM490 called at 9:40am.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history and status of the cases. 
Atty. Svehlek has no explanation for the non-appearance of the Defendant. 
State moves for issuance of a bench warrant in each case; so ordered by the Court. 
State moves that the signature bond in each case be forfeited; so ordered by the Court. 
Recess 9:43am

Cases 15CM434, 15CM488 & 15CM490 called together at 11:21 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Johnathon J. Jacobson in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

15CM488 & 15CM490
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Lisa Jacobson

-No possession of drug paraphernalia

Atty Svehlek requests STC in 30 days on all matters
